Operator

Well an operator is a predefined function for the language. Itâ€™s a function defined in the JIT compiler. It will read through your code and when it reaches an operator it will actually run a function.

Well with the JIT compiler Itâ€™s actually got these operators pre-defined, ready to be executed in memory. And it can be run right in memory so itâ€™s predefined functionality. Itâ€™s a predefined subroutine just like you going downstairs performing an action like making a cup of coffee.

Of course an operator is a task something youâ€™re asking the compiler to do. And It is a Function.

B O DM AS

And so this is how I remember the operators in a mathematical statement and the order in which they are executed.

Brackets, pOwers(functions), DivisionMultiplication(*/), AdditionSubstraction(+-)

polymorphism

What does polymorphism mean? Likewise we have polymorphism here which means it can do and adapt to different situations is ready to change and mutate.

So instead of being an addition operator that adds to the mix together. This polymorphs and it can actually concatenate two strings together.

Or if you have a string any way either to the left of it or to the right of it.

So letâ€™s say a number to the right of it and a string to the left of it you will notice that what it does is, It polymorphs. It takes the number ,the integer, and it actually converts it into the string data type. It adapts.

So strings always take precedent once you have a string there on either side of the plus operator.

It will automatically change whatever it is, it will convert the Boolean type into a string data type and combine them

both together. So thatâ€™s what we call polymorphism.

  • polymorphism
